sections.title: Introduction
sections.body: Welcome to SGV Institute module on Project Management Fundamentals, Tools and Techniques! This module is designed to provide you with a comprehensive understanding of project management, project management functions, tools, techniques, and frameworks, and project lifecycle.

sections.title: Defining Project
sections.body: A project is a temporary endeavor undertaken to create a unique product, service or result.
sections.body2: A project is distinct from routine operations and has a singular goal
sections.body3: A project is temporary in that it has a defined beginning and end in time, and therefore defined scope and resources

questions.q_statement: BSO Unibank is considering to initiate a project, to align stakeholder expectations and prepare the detailed plans for the project, what kind of document should the project team must create?
A good, solid plan answers several questions related to the following aspects of a project: (Select all that apply)

q_selection.A: How much time do we have to finish the tasks?
q_selection.B: What are the roles and responsibilities of people involved in the project?
q_selection.C: What are the rationale, goals, and objectives of the project?

questions.q_statement: Projects an be initiated for various reasons, usually when there is a ___________.
Milestones are meaningful when communicating the ____________ with the project team, key stakeholders, and sponsors.

q_selection.C: beginning and end of the project

questions.q_statement: Question 5
What principle is a key approach for developing an emergent high-level paln, which is then revisited in subsequent phases for further development and refinement of a detailed or robust project plan?
Critical Path Method or CPM is used to ______, ______, and ______ the plan's activities and timing. The CPM is used to evaluate and optimize project plans. (Select all that apply)
Assignment is the matchmaking of a resource to a task in a project plan. Assigning resources allows you to answer which questions? (Select all that apply)

q_selection.A: Have you assigned so many tasks that a resource is beyond capacity?
q_selection.C: Are you expecting a resource to work on a task when they are not available?
q_selection.D: Who should be working on what task and when?

questions.q_statement: Which of the following describes Issue Management?

q_selection.A: The process helps the project team to understand what to do with issues once identified. The Project Manager should ensure that the project team has the required skills to facilitate the movement of an issue throughout the process.
q_selection.B: It allows the project team to document, proactively account for, and address items interrelated with the project.
q_selection.C: When effectively employed, stakeholder management is critical to the success of a project.

questions.q_statement: You are managing a project that involves multiple phases and a significant budget. As part of your responsibilities, you need to ensure effective financial control throughout the project's lifecycle. Which of the following processes are required to maintain effective financial control of a project?

q_selection.A: Estimating, budgeting, and controlling project costs
q_selection.D: Allocating resources and managing team performance

questions.q_statement: The Earned Value Management (EVM) develops and monitors three key dimensions for each work package and control account. This dimension is the realized cost incurred for the work performed on an activity during a specific time period.

Juan is an IT professional who specializes in digitally transforming banks for over 20 years. The current bank that he’s working under assigned him to pitch a project in which he will be spearheading alongside Pedro, the operations manager. The CEO told Juan and Pedro that the board believes that the bank is already matured in its operations and is equipped with enough resources and competencies to expand its reach, therefore wanting the bank to have its own mobile application. During the planning phase of the project, which cost estimating technique is best for Juan and Pedro to use for their pitch?
Which of the choices is one of the four functions of cost management?
This budgeting methodology focuses on value-adding processes of an organization.
The biggest challenge of this budgeting methodology is ensuring the commitment of all employees to be in constant budgeting mode.
This cost estimation technique accounts for risk factors, therefore arriving at the best, worst, and most likely case scenarios.
An organization’s strategy in quantitative form.
Cash flows are crucial for the financial health of a project or business. In which of the following situations are cash flows particularly important?

q_selection.A: Always, especially in times of change or where there is a reasonable degree of risk
q_selection.B: Only if you are short of money
q_selection.C: Only if you have a surplus
q_selection.D: Only if income and/or expenses are particularly variable

questions.q_statement: First National Bank is a mid-sized financial institution that has been facing challenges with its traditional budgeting process. The management team has noticed that the current budgeting system lacks accuracy and transparency, leading to inefficiencies and cost overruns. To address these issues, the bank decided to implement activity-based budgeting (ABB). After conducting a thorough analysis of their operations, First National Bank identified the key activities that drive costs within the organization. They focused on supporting value-adding processes and improving the accuracy of cost measurement. The implementation of ABB provided a much more accurate cost plan, control, and evaluation. Evaluate the impact of improved cost measurement accuracy on the financial planning and decision-making process at First National Bank.

q_selection.A: More accurate and reliable financial data for planning and forecasting
q_selection.B: Better identification of cost drivers and areas for cost reduction
q_selection.C: Improved ability to make informed strategic decisions based on detailed cost analysis

Which risk strategy is used to reduce the probability and/or impact of a risk event?

q_selection.B: capture, organize, prioritize and document the risks, assumptions, issues and dependencies encountered while planning for and executing the project

q_selection.D: Explore establishment of an Industry Cyber Innovation/Research Hub
